Text:
I don't believe you will see an official dvd of this. It was originaly "filmed" on video in the days when video was still something new. The original tapes were destroyed so there is no original master to use. 

It was released on laser disk but I haven't seen it so I can't vouch for its quality.
Man I'm impresssed by the work you've done, thanx for the upload, I really like old Zappa music. I think he went way too commercial after sheik yerbouti, but this i Zappa at his peak. Thanx again.
i'm new to this.  what do I do, just burn this to a dvd-r and then watch in in my dvd player?

Your dear mother:
Yes! Just burn it for example with Nero burning rom to a dvd-r disc. Watch and enjoy in your dvd-player.
This one's been taking me over a week now . . . but you can rest assured that this will be one DL that I *WILL* keep seeding long after I finish!
Help!  There's two of us stuck at 48% . . . can some kind person please please please seed?

Oh, wow.  I just realized I was trying to download a different torrent.  I have since quit that one, and started this one -- its health is MUCH better!  I also humbly apologize for my begging, as well as the proxy accusation of McGrupp not keeping it seeded.  :)  I hope you all can forgive me (and my promise still stands to keep this seed going!)

Fantastic!been looking for this since I saw it in the theater,around'76.Want to see it without Albert Hoffman's influence.I also have a 1963 clip of Zappa on the Steve Allen show I will up soon.
Thanks for doing all the work,considering you don't get paid.Nice.

Man, this is awsome! Thanks!

bowcat: haha, why did you see THIS movie with the influence? That's what we have Alice In Wonderland for!
Awesome. Thanks a ton, man. Will seed for a very long time.

Wow, thanks for all your hard work.
I was going to buy the VHS years ago but......

I've been a fan for 30+ years and look forward to seeing this classic again.

Kiitos!
Thanks so much for putting this up. This is one of my all time favourite films. I will be seeding this forever.
Thanx for this-hope this is good quality, saw Frank in London around 72-73, miss him dearly...........
